question.title: How to execute AppDynamics Machine Agent in Azure Function App without manual execution?
question.body:
I am trying to integrate AppDynamics Machine Agent with my Azure Function App. I have downloaded and placed the Machine Agent in the directory /opt/appdynamics/machine-agent and I want to execute it using the command ./bin/machine-agent. However, I am running into issues with Azure Function App not allowing the execution of this command.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

I attempted to run the command directly within the Azure Function App, I created a script to execute the command and placed it in the startup folder for the Function App, but this also didn’t work. How can I dynamically start the AppDynamics Machine Agent within my Azure Function App without manual intervention? Are there specific steps or configurations I need to follow in Azure to execute system commands or scripts like this from a Function App?

Environment:

Azure Function App (Linux) AppDynamics Machine Agent Trying to run command from /opt/appdynamics/machine-agent Thanks in advance for your help!
